page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY. FARMS
page.content: PARK HOUSE FARM There is an older part of the farm house which was built in 1604.This formed part of the dining hall and was used by the working monks.This room contains the original lnglenook fireplace which was part of the kitchen.The newer part of the house was built in 1810 on the foundations of the dining hall.The farm has four man_made fish ponds which were farmed by the monks.These are now dry due to the water deing dammed at Dean Lake. The boundaries of the farm are surrounded by the ruins of a wall which was built by the monks and which is known as the Monks'Wall.It is now a dairy farm,but there are a few young beef calves too.They use Leyburn market for calves and Otley for well_ bred dales cattle.
